messages.title: Instant messages
messages.description: Highly innovative instant messaging includes unique features such as sending files with unlimited size, widgets, multipart messages, multiple topics within a conversation, message templates and much more.

social.title: Social media
social.description: The platform offers advanced social media features such as video channels, forum, newsfeed, stories, events, virtual world, maps and more.

ecommerce.title: E-commerce
ecommerce.description: Thanks to the integration of a crypto wallet that supports smart contracts, the platform offers advanced e-commerce features that are linked with the wallet. These include features such as: sending payments between users, making purchases in e-shops, marketplace and virtual chat, sending donations to specific purposes, supporting crowdfunding campaigns, selling video content within video channels, sending payments during live streams, topping up your own content, buying premium memberships, in-game payments and much more.

business.title: Business tools
business.description: Modules such as Calendar and Tasks, provide business users with an easy way to organise, share and support productivity in the work environment.

entertainment.title: Entertainment
entertainment.description: Within the platform, you can even have fun with features such as dating and video games.

box1.title: Distributed and decentralized network
box1.description:
Platform offers innovative network protocols AMTP and DMTP.

AMTP (Advanced Mail Transfer Protocol) - A next-generation, partially censorship-resistant protocol where data is stored on distributed servers and synchronized with end-user devices.

DMTP (Decentralized Mail Transfer Protocol) - An upcoming fully censorship-resistant protocol, eliminating central servers entirely and relying on decentralized storage.

box2.title: Privacy and security
box2.description: Protect your privacy and communicate safely! The platform emphasizes a high level of security, primarily through encrypted data transfer, end-to-end encryption and content digital signing, as well as providing simple and secure transfer of user's private keys across devices.

box3.title: Open source
box3.description: The client and server applications, as well as the entire set of modules, are released as open source. This ensures transparency and credibility of our project. Developers worldwide can create or integrate new modules, ensuring that the platform continually evolves.

box4.title: Modularity
box4.description: Whether you want to use the platform just for messaging or a full suite of social and e-commerce tools, the platform's modular design puts you in charge of your user experience. Choose just the features you really use.

item1.question: What is Yellow?
item1.answer: Yellow is a multi-functional communication application that offers innovative features for secure and efficient instant messaging, social media services, e-commerce, business tools and entertainment. It is also a tool for building a parallel economy based on decentralized technologies such as cryptocurrencies and smart contracts. It communicates via secure AMTP and DMTP protocols.

item2.question: What is AMTP?
item2.answer: Advanced Mail Transfer Protocol (AMTP) is the new generation of e-mail protocol. It fully replaces the traditional e-mail protocols (SMTP, IMAP and POP3) and greatly expands their functionality. The protocol provides enhanced security in the form of secure login, encrypted data transfer, content signing and end-to-end encryption capabilities. Data is transmitted in real time, unlike traditional e-mail protocols, allowing not only instant messages but also files and data streams to be transmitted in real time. User identity is similar to traditional e-mail protocols, in the form of an e-mail address (user@domain.tld). Communication takes place within a distributed network.

item3.question: What is DMTP?
item3.answer: Decentralized Mail Transfer Protocol (DMTP) is an upcoming protocol that completely eliminates central servers and relies on decentralized transfer and decentralized data storage. DMTP is designed to be fully censorship-resistant and provide users with the maximum level of privacy and security. It allows users to communicate directly with each other without the need for intermediaries. This provides users with a significant degree of privacy. Users create their own identity (which is in the form of a public address, similar to that of cryptocurrencies, for example). The network is fully decentralised and there is no central authority to manage user accounts.

item4.question: Why is the software named "Yellow"?
item4.answer: As Yellow is, among other reasons, a project aimed at building a parallel economy based on decentralized technologies such as cryptocurrencies and smart contracts, the name was chosen because yellow is a symbol of the abundance and wealth that this economy brings. Plus, Yellow sounds a bit like Hello, which is a word that can start any conversation in the instant messages that the platform also delivers.

item5.question: Is Yellow client application backward compatible with classic e-mail protocols (SMTP, IMAP, POP3)?
item5.answer: No. Yellow is not compatible with traditional e-mail protocols such as SMTP, IMAP and POP3. Instead, the platform aims to replace these outdated protocols with the next generation of AMTP and DMTP. These protocols provide improved security, speed and greatly expand functionality that traditional e-mail protocols cannot offer.
